techniques.name: Visualization/Mental Imagery
techniques.rationale: Peak performance staple, extensive neuroscience research, builds neural pathways through vivid sensory rehearsal, fully audio-guided, used by elite athletes and executives

techniques.name: Positive Self-Talk
techniques.rationale: Immediate performance enhancement, strong sports psychology research base, reinforces confidence during high-pressure situations, easily audio-scripted

techniques.name: Performance Cues/Trigger Words
techniques.rationale: Activates focused attention instantly, used in athletics and military, combines conditioning with state management, perfect for audio cue installation

techniques.name: Pre-Performance Routines
techniques.rationale: Establishes optimal arousal, consistent behavioral sequences enhance focus, extensive sports psychology research, audio can guide routine establishment

techniques.name: Arousal Regulation
techniques.rationale: Yerkes-Dodson Law foundation, optimizes physiological activation for peak performance, critical for high-stakes situations, audio-guided breathing and body awareness

techniques.name: Centering Technique
techniques.rationale: Robert Nideffer's breath-focused attention technique, directs focus to center of gravity, rapid state shift, purely audio-compatible

techniques.name: Progressive Muscle Relaxation
techniques.rationale: Edmund Jacobson's classic, reduces performance anxiety, systematic tension-release, well-researched, audio-guided tension patterns

techniques.name: Thought-Stopping
techniques.rationale: Cognitive-behavioral technique, interrupts negative thought spirals, redirects focus, simple audio cues, effective for performance anxiety

techniques.name: Anchoring (NLP)
techniques.rationale: Peak performance technique, strong Pavlovian foundation, widely used in sports/business coaching, audio can install kinesthetic anchors, instant state access

techniques.name: Circle of Excellence
techniques.rationale: Visualizes performance circle, stacks peak states, spatial anchoring, powerful pre-performance ritual, fully audio-guided

techniques.name: Resource Anchoring
techniques.rationale: Anchors specific positive resources (confidence, focus, energy), on-demand state access, practical for business settings, audio-compatible

techniques.name: Stacking Anchors
techniques.rationale: Layers multiple positive states onto single trigger, creates compound performance state, audio can guide multiple state recalls

techniques.name: Swish Pattern
techniques.rationale: Replaces limiting patterns with empowering self-image, rapid pattern interrupt, Bandler/Grinder technique, audio guides visual swap

techniques.name: New Behavior Generator
techniques.rationale: Creates and rehearses new behavioral responses, mental practice for skill acquisition, audio-guided visualization

techniques.name: Perceptual Positions
techniques.rationale: Shifts perspective between self/other/observer, enhances emotional intelligence, useful for leadership, audio guides perspective shifts

techniques.name: Submodalities Work
techniques.rationale: Adjusts sensory details of mental images to change emotional impact, reduces fear, amplifies motivation, audio-guided sensory manipulation

techniques.name: Future Pacing
techniques.rationale: Mental rehearsal in future contexts, programs unconscious for success, Ericksonian/NLP foundation, audio-guided scenario practice

techniques.name: Strategy Elicitation and Installation
techniques.rationale: Models successful mental strategies and installs them, skill acceleration technique, audio can guide strategy modeling

techniques.name: Progressive Relaxation Induction
techniques.rationale: Classic Jacobson technique adapted for hypnosis, establishes deep relaxation baseline, fully audio-guided body scan

techniques.name: Dave Elman Induction
techniques.rationale: Rapid structured induction (1950s), eye closure to number disappearance, time-efficient, audio-compatible steps

techniques.name: Arm Levitation Induction
techniques.rationale: Suggests arm floating upward to transition into trance, ideomotor response, audio suggests lightness and floating

techniques.name: Confusion Technique
techniques.rationale: Milton Erickson's classic, overloads conscious mind with paradoxes, creates natural trance, audio delivers complex patterns

techniques.name: Naturalistic Trance Induction
techniques.rationale: Ericksonian conversational hypnosis, uses ordinary storytelling, no formal induction needed, perfect for audio narrative

techniques.name: Betty Erickson 3-2-1 Technique
techniques.rationale: Self-hypnosis method, alternates external/internal sensory observations, reducing from 3 to 1, audio guides sensory attention

techniques.name: Countdown Breathing
techniques.rationale: Counts down from 100 with each exhale, self-hypnosis technique, combines breath focus with progressive deepening, simple audio guidance

techniques.name: Fractionation
techniques.rationale: Dave Elman/Bernheim technique, repeatedly brings in/out of trance, each cycle deepens state, audio guides cycles

techniques.name: Staircase Deepener
techniques.rationale: Descends mental staircase, doubling relaxation with each step, classic deepening technique, vivid audio imagery

techniques.name: Embedded Commands
techniques.rationale: Milton Model/NLP, commands hidden in sentences marked by tone shift, bypasses conscious resistance, audio tonality shifts

techniques.name: Pacing and Leading
techniques.rationale: Starts with verifiable truths then leads to suggestions, builds unconscious agreement, Milton Model foundation, audio narrative technique

techniques.name: Metaphor and Storytelling
techniques.rationale: Ericksonian indirect suggestion, delivers messages through stories, bypasses resistance, perfect for audio meditation format

techniques.name: Mental Rehearsal (Performance Hypnosis)
techniques.rationale: Vividly imagines successful performance to program unconscious, sports/performance hypnosis staple, audio guides detailed sensory rehearsal

techniques.name: Post-Hypnotic Suggestion
techniques.rationale: Suggestions activate after awakening, programs future behavior, classical hypnosis foundation, audio installs performance triggers

techniques.name: Mastery Experiences
techniques.rationale: Bandura's self-efficacy builder, recalls past successes to build confidence, strong research base, audio guides success recall

techniques.name: Verbal Persuasion
techniques.rationale: Bandura's self-efficacy technique, encouragement from credible sources builds capability beliefs, audio acts as credible coach voice

techniques.name: Implementation Intentions
techniques.rationale: Gollwitzer's if-then planning, automates goal-directed behavior, strong research base, audio guides specific plan creation

techniques.name: Mental Contrasting
techniques.rationale: Oettingen's technique, compares desired future with current obstacles, mobilizes energy, audio guides contrast exercise

techniques.name: Growth Mindset Cultivation
techniques.rationale: Carol Dweck's framework, develops belief that abilities grow through effort, extensive research, audio reframes challenges

techniques.name: Attribution Retraining
techniques.rationale: Weiner's technique, attributes failures to controllable factors (effort) not ability, increases persistence, audio guides reattribution

techniques.name: Explanatory Style Modification
techniques.rationale: Seligman's optimism training, changes pessimistic patterns to optimistic, increases persistence, audio guides style shifts

techniques.name: Best Possible Self Exercise
techniques.rationale: Positive psychology technique, visualizes ideal future self, clarifies goals and increases optimism, audio guides detailed visualization

techniques.name: Psychological Capital (PsyCap) Development
techniques.rationale: Fred Luthans' HERO model (Hope, Efficacy, Resilience, Optimism), builds positive resources, organizational psychology research, audio develops all four

techniques.name: Cognitive Reframing
techniques.rationale: Changes interpretation of situations to enhance motivation, cognitive psychology foundation, audio guides perspective shifts

techniques.name: Values Clarification
techniques.rationale: Connects goals to core personal values, enhances intrinsic motivation, coaching psychology, audio guides value exploration

techniques.name: Meaning-Making
techniques.rationale: Viktor Frankl inspired, connects activities to larger purpose, sustains motivation through adversity, audio guides meaning connection

techniques.name: Safe Place Visualization
techniques.rationale: Creates internal sanctuary for resource access, clinical hypnotherapy standard, establishes calm baseline, audio guides detailed safe space creation

techniques.name: Autogenic Training
techniques.rationale: Johannes Schultz's 6-exercise system, auto-suggestions of heaviness/warmth/calm, extensive European research, audio guides systematic relaxation

visualOnly: Shock Induction (stage hypnosis, requires physical manipulation)
All Mesmeric Passes (require in-person physical contact)
Hand Drop Induction (requires in-person physical contact)
Arm Pull Induction (requires in-person physical contact)
Postural Sway Induction (requires in-person physical setup)
manipulationTechniques: All DARVO and narcissistic abuse techniques
All cult and thought reform techniques (coercive control)
tooSlow: Deliberate Practice (long-term skill building, not single session)

implementationNotes.scriptingApproach: Each technique requires specific audio script structure with clear performance context
implementationNotes.combinationPotential: Many techniques can be layered within single meditation (e.g., progressive relaxation + embedded commands + anchoring)
implementationNotes.userProfileMapping: Different techniques appeal to different archetypes (Warrior prefers centering/arousal regulation, Scholar prefers cognitive reframing)
implementationNotes.durationVariability: Most techniques can be adapted from 2-5 minutes depending on depth
implementationNotes.evidenceGathering: Priority research: published studies on each technique's efficacy for performance enhancement

nextSteps: Research academic papers for each tier 1 technique
Create detailed script templates for top 8 techniques
Map techniques to user archetypes and stress scenarios
Design combination protocols (2-3 techniques per meditation)
Develop evidence database with citations for each technique
